marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: EXCL's performance is still pressured by integration costs starting to be booked post-merger. However, performance in 3Q25 has started to show recovery, driven by an increase in ARPU in line with the industry recovery. EXCL management also sees room for ARPU improvement in the coming quarter, aligning with the focus on customers with stronger revenue contributions.

marketNews.title: Government Reportedly Supports GOTO & Grab Merger Opportunity
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that the Indonesian government fully supports the possibility of a merger between GoTo Gojek Tokopedia and Grab. Previously, Reuters reported in June 2025 that the government opposed the corporate action plan and requested better tariff guarantees and bonuses for online motorcycle taxi drivers. Reuters sources also reported that Danantara is currently in talks to take a 'golden share' in the combined entity of the two ride-hailing companies. A golden share usually grants veto rights over important decisions, even with a small stake. The government and Danantara have not commented on this news, while Grab declined to comment.

marketNews.title: Minister of Trade Discusses Coal DMO Portion Increase
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, said that the ministry is considering the option to increase the domestic market obligation (DMO) portion to above 25% of total production. Bahlil's statement emerged after Commission XII of the DPR member from the Gerindra faction, Ramson Siagian, highlighted the imbalance in DMO supply between State-Owned Enterprises and private mining companies, where Bukit Asam's ($PTBA) DMO portion is much larger than its obligation while other companies do not meet the 25% requirement.

marketNews.title: Government to Start Safety Tests for B50 Blending Program
marketNews.content: The Director-General at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Eniya Listiani Dewi, said on Thursday (13/11) that the government will start road safety tests for the 50% biodiesel blending program or B50 in early December 2025. The decision on the launch of B50 will depend on the results of these tests, which are expected to be known after 6 months. Eniya also mentioned that the government is considering a partial implementation option for B50, which is only for the public service obligation sector, due to potential supply disruptions. Meanwhile, the President Director of the Palm Oil Plantation Fund Management Agency, Eddy Abdurrachman, on the same occasion stated that the biodiesel program must diversify its raw materials by including waste-based oils—such as used cooking oil—to reduce dependence on CPO, which is vulnerable to price fluctuations.

marketNews.title: CPOPC Forecasts Stagnant Global Palm Oil Production in 2026
marketNews.content: The Director of the Council of Palm Oil Producing Countries (CPOPC), Chandran Gunalan, stated that the organization forecasts global palm oil production in 2026 will stagnate around 82 million tons due to La Nina, the aging of trees in Malaysia, slow replanting and land clearing in Indonesia, as well as high fertilizer costs. CPOPC estimates production from Indonesia to reach around 50 million tons in 2026, while Malaysia's will be around 20 million tons.

marketNews.title: Replanting Program Realization Remains Low
marketNews.content: The Acting Director-General of Plantations at the Ministry of Agriculture, Abdul Roni Angkat, said on Thursday (13/11) that the realization of the smallholder palm oil replanting program has only reached 23,000 hectares as of October 2025, achieving only about 19.1% of the 2025 target of 120,000 hectares. Last year, the realization of this program only reached less than 50,000 hectares, or about 41% of the 2024 target. Bloomberg noted that approximately 2.8 million hectares of agricultural land owned by smallholders in Indonesia need to be replanted due to aging trees. Smallholders own a total of 6.94 million hectares of palm oil plantation land in Indonesia.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Palm Oil Production Reached 43 Million Tons in 9M25
marketNews.content: The Chairman of Gapki, Eddy Martono, stated that Indonesian palm oil production over 9M25 reached approximately 43 million tons (+11% YoY). Exports of palm oil-based products during 9M25—including oleochemicals and biodiesel—reached more than 25 million tons, an increase of about +13% YoY. Meanwhile, domestic consumption rose to 18.5 million tons, an increase of about +5% YoY.

marketNews.title: SKK Migas Projects National Oil Lifting to Exceed 2025 APBN Target
marketNews.content: The Head of SKK Migas, Djoko Siswanto, said that the realization of national oil lifting is projected to be around 606,000-607,000 barrels per day in 2025, exceeding the 2025 APBN target of 605,000 barrels per day. This projection is based on the oil lifting realization as of November 10, 2025, which has reached approximately 606,000 barrels per day.

marketNews.title: Ford Reportedly Exploring Building a Car Factory in West Java
marketNews.content: CNN Indonesia reported that US car manufacturer, Ford Motor Co., is exploring plans to build a vehicle assembly plant in West Java. According to Roelof Lamberts, director of RMA Indonesia—Ford's official distributor—the construction of the plant could begin in 2027.

marketNews.title: Reading the Beat Behind RSI: The Secret of True Momentum Hunters
marketNews.content: "Conversely, when a stock is in a downtrend, RSI appears oversold (≤30) but Stochastic RSI can form an overbought condition."

tickerNews.title: XL Smart Telecom Sejahtera Reports Net Loss in 3Q25 Driven by Integration Costs
tickerNews.content: XL Smart Telecom Sejahtera ($EXCL) recorded a net loss of approximately 1.4 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: loss of 1.6 trillion rupiah, 3Q24: net profit of 292 billion rupiah). This result brings the net loss for 9M25 to 2.6 trillion rupiah (vs. 9M24: net profit of 1.3 trillion rupiah), below the 2025F consensus expectation which projected a net loss of 809 billion rupiah. In general, the loss in 3Q25 was driven by the continued booking of post-merger integration costs, causing the gross profit margin to shrink to 13.8% (vs. 3Q24: 28%, 2Q25: 16.7%), resulting in gross profit in 3Q25 dropping -10% QoQ.

tickerNews.title: Post-Merger Operations: ARPU Increases, but Integration Costs Rise for EXCL
tickerNews.content: After experiencing a decrease in ARPU post-merger to 35,500 rupiah in 2Q25, EXCL recorded a quarterly increase in ARPU to 38,900 rupiah in 3Q25 (-6% YoY, +9.6% QoQ). Meanwhile, the number of customers dropped quarterly to 79.6 million (+35.8% YoY, -3.6% QoQ), which according to EXCL management was caused by the culling of low-ARPU service packages. Management itself explained that the company will focus more on customer segments that can provide higher added value, reflected in the revenue per data (data yield) in 3Q25 which increased quarterly to 2.6 rupiah per MB (-10.7% YoY, +5.1% QoQ). Furthermore, the net loss in 3Q25 was primarily caused by an increase in the cost of goods sold (+13% QoQ) and opex (+5% QoQ), as full integration costs began to be booked since the merger became effective on April 16, 2025. The increase in the cost of goods sold in 3Q25 was driven by an increase in depreciation expense (+14% QoQ) following the acceleration of depreciation on assets that are no longer in use, including network equipment related to the 900 MHz spectrum which must be returned by the end of 2026. EXCL management explained that integration costs will continue until the integration process is complete by 4Q26 or 1Q27. EXCL has budgeted integration costs of 1.5 trillion rupiah throughout 2025, of which approx. 1 trillion rupiah has been booked during 9M25 and the remainder in 4Q25. For 2026, the company expects integration costs to remain around the same level as 2025. If one-off expenses—such as integration, accelerated depreciation, and impairment—are set aside, management estimates the company still achieved a normalized profit after tax of approximately 1.2 trillion rupiah in 3Q25. Looking at the revenue realization during 9M25 which reached only 73% of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. 9M24: 74% annual realization), we assess that the consensus estimate is still achievable, considering the quite high quarterly ARPU increase in 3Q25 and management's expectation that there is still room to raise ARPU in the coming quarter.

tickerNews.title: EXCL Opens Opportunity for Additional Final Dividend Distribution for Fiscal Year 2024 in 2025
tickerNews.content: EXCL opens the opportunity for an additional final dividend distribution in 2025, which will originate from retained earnings from the 2024 fiscal year. Management will seek approval regarding this plan at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (EGMS) on November 21, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bukit Asam Signs Senior Term Facility of Up To IDR 3.6 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Bukit Asam ($PTBA) signed a senior term facility of up to approximately 3.6 trillion rupiah from Bank Mandiri ($BMRI), Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI), and Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI). The 5-year tenor facility is intended to finance the development of railway transportation capacity for the Tanjung Enim-Keramasan route, which will increase transportation capacity by 20 million tons per year with a target for commercial operation in 2Q26.

tickerNews.title: Intiland Development (DILD) Tapped as Initiator for Minister's Housing Project in IKN Nusantara with Investment Estimate of IDR 2.9 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Bisnis reported that IKN Nusantara officially appointed Intiland Development as the initiator for the minister's housing project in IKN Nusantara under the Public-Private Partnership (KPBU) scheme. The estimated investment for this project reaches approximately 2.9 trillion rupiah, with compensation for DILD in the form of a value addition of 10%.

tickerNews.title: Bank BPD East Java (BJTM) Forms Bank Business Group with Bank Sultra and Bank Lampung Through Capital Injection
tickerNews.content: Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Timur announced the formation of a bank business group (KUB) with PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Sulawesi Tenggara (Bank Sultra) and PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Lampung (Bank Lampung). In this transaction, BJTM injected capital into Bank Sultra and Bank Lampung amounting to 100 billion rupiah each. After this transaction, the financial statements of both banks will be consolidated into BJTM.

tickerNews.title: Cahayasakti Investindo Sukses (CSIS) Plans Capital Injection to Subsidiary for Industrial Area Development, Funded by Upcoming Rights Issue
tickerNews.content: Cahayasakti Investindo Sukses plans to inject capital of approximately 195.8 billion rupiah to its subsidiary, PT Bogorindo Cemerlang. The funds will subsequently be used by PT Bogorindo Cemerlang for infrastructure development in the Cikembar Industrial Estate, infrastructure development in Bukit Panenjoan, and land bank purchases to expand the Cikembar Industrial Estate. This capital injection originates from the proceeds of a rights issue that the company will hold in early December 2025. This plan for capital injection will be discussed at the EGMS on December 19, 2025. After this transaction is completed, CSIS's ownership stake in PT Bogorindo Cemerlang will increase from 52.5% to 61.58%.

tickerNews.title: WIKA Targets New Contracts Exceeding IDR 20 Trillion in 2026
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Wijaya Karya, Agung Budi Waskito, stated that the company targets the value of new contracts in 2026 to exceed 20 trillion rupiah, an increase of at least +18% compared to the 2025 projection of 17 trillion rupiah. Agung explained that the 2026 target is in line with the company's transformation strategy, as well as expectations for recovery in project demand next year. During 9M25, WIKA recorded a new contract value of 6.19 trillion rupiah (-60% YoY).

tickerNews.title: US President Donald Trump Signs Government Funding Bill Ending Shutdown
tickerNews.content: President Donald Trump signed a temporary budget bill on Wednesday (12/11) local time to end the US federal government shutdown that had been ongoing since October 1, 2025.
